results.title: The Tree
results.creator_credit: International Council for Education Media and Georg Schimanski
results.brief_description: Time-lapse photography helps us appreciate the marvellous seasonal changes undergone by a large oak tree. These changes also affect the many animals and insects that feed and live in the tree. Among other things, the film describes how the tree nourishes itself during the growing season, how it synthesizes various elements during the day and at night. The tree and the creatures who inhabit it form an impressive microcosm, kept in good health by natural checks and balances.

results.title: The Travelling tune: a musical phantasy in paper
results.brief_description: A round the world journey in which we see American jazz trumpeters, Venetian goldoliers, Mexican cowboys, Amerstdam canal-side houses, New York skyscrpaers and Bavarian beer mugs. All these scenes are created from colorful paper cutouts.

results.title: The Travelling players = O Thiassos [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Papalios Productions, Giorgos Samiotis and Theo Angelopoulos
results.brief_description: With the release of “The Travelling players” in 1975, Theo Angelopoulos cemented a reputation as one of the leading filmmakers of his generation. Released just after the collapse of the fascist military junta, the film’s international critical success led to a short-lived Renaissance for Greek language cinema. Angelopoulos’s mise-en-scene for “The Travelling players” involves complicated long takes, a concentrated editing and shooting of scenes that allows for the distillation of time and space that is comparable to Tarkosvsky, Welles and Visconti. In “The Travelling players” a small group of thespians travel through Greece performing plays based on Greek history and myth. They become our witness to the modern history of Greece as they take us through the fall of the Ottoman Empire, the tragedies of the two World Wars, the calamities of the Civil War and the resulting political oppression culminating in the establishment of the Junta in 1966 by the Greek military. The “players” find themselves moving across the stage of history itself, and caught in the modern human dilemma of wishing to escape history and consciousness but never able to do so. The film also becomes a mythic investigation of fascism and its destructiveness, and also a passionate, if pessimistic, cry for truth and liberation, that itself echoes with the poisoned chalice of Greece’s democratic history. Angelopoulos makes no concessions to notions of populist or commercially based cinema. “The Travelling players” assumes knowledge of Greek history, both ancient and modern, as well as assuming that it is viewed by a literate audience familiar with modernist conceptions of philosophical and political engagement. For some audiences, “The Travelling players” might be read as elitist and obscure. But for those who decide to commit and engage with the film, its formal experimentations and intellectual concerns, they may find it one of the astounding cinematic experiences. Winner of the Palme d’Or at Cannes. In Greek with English subtitles.

results.title: The Travel game
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Ian Ferguson and Tony Thompson
results.brief_description: As the Hook Continental express leaves Liverpool Street Station, a passenger starts to guess where his fellow passengers are going. In his imagination the journey becomes interwoven with scenes of his travelling companions at their supposed destinations: among the windmills, diamonds and cheeses of Holland; at a Rhine wine festival; on Mount Pilatus in Switzerland; in Denmark and Germany.

results.title: The Trap
results.creator_credit: Harvest Films, Leo Trachtenberg and Alfred Socolow
results.brief_description: Interviews conducted with people who have been injured in the work place by ignoring safety procedures. In-depth accounts of the consequences of incidents that have left workers disabled and scarred by these traumatic events. Re-enactments of accidents that have occurred in the work place, reinforcing the practice of safety procedures.

results.title: The Transition tapes
results.brief_description: These tapes are intended to aid the Transition Education evaluation process by raising relevant questions and issues. They enable re-assessment of attitudes to learning and resources, employment and unemployment from five viewpoints : student, teacher, community, employer and school administrator. No other credits available.

results.title: The Tragic pursuit of perfection
results.creator_credit: Triangle Film Productions and Enrico Fulchinoni
results.brief_description: An experiment in creating a dramatic biography from a painter’s work. The film covers a great deal of Leonardo de Vinci’s activities, explores his sketch books and notebooks, his extraordinary designs for machines of war, his correspondence, his drawings and paintings and his unfinished statuary. “The Tragic pursuit of perfection” is the theme of the film illustrated by the history of “The Last supper”.

results.title: The Traditional world of Islam: the inner life
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross Ltd, Paul Keeler and Stephen Cross
results.brief_description: Explores the inner life, the mystical path within Islam known as Sufism and the role it has played with the civilization. This film is part of a series which examines various aspects of Islamic civilization. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Traditional world of Islam: nomad and city
results.brief_description: The nomads and the city dwellers - these are the two roles of Islamic civilization, and it is the tension existing between the two which has given to it an inner energy and capacity for self-renewal.
